intro: Telephium purpureum, commonly known as showy stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is well adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Telephium purpureum is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
